characters: BETWEEN BILLI AND NAI NAI FOR PHONE CONVERSATION

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: [Hello?] [*Note: All Chinese Mandarin dialogue in brackets. Other languages will not be subtitled. ] NAI NAI (80) walks into frame holding a cell phone. A hea neatly-permed white hair, this woman is the consummate matriarch.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: [Nai Nai. Hi!] Hearing her granddaughter’s cheerful voice, Nai Nai break into a warm smile.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Billi! It’s the middle of the night there, why aren’t you sleeping? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: [Middle of the night? It’s seven...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Seven at night?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Horns BLARE as BILLI WANG (30) walks quickly through the kinetic streets of New York City. She’s in her element he Her movement is effortless, even as she switches between speaking Mandarin and English. WE INTERCUT BETWEEN THEIR PHONE CONVERSATION.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Yea, it's always twelve hours time difference! Isn’t it seven in the morning in China?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s almost seven thirty!] (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Is it cold there? Are you wearing enough? Cold travels through the head! Are you wearing a hat?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: {I am.] (she’s definitely not) [Stop worrying about me! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You have to be careful. I read that in New York there are men who steal your earrings. They rip them out! And then you have to go to the hospital to get your ears stitched up!]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I’m not wearing earrings, Nai Nail]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Ah. So you heard too. ] A loud Chinese ANNOUNCEMENT blares through the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Hey, what’s that sound? Nai Nai, where are you?] The announcement continues.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Me? I'm... I'm at your great aunt’s house. ] Clearly in a hospital, Nai Nai tells this lie with total ease.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [What are you doing? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I’m heading to Mom and Dad's for dinner...] Before Billi can finish, a STREET CANVASSER interrupts wi performative cheerfulness.

dialogues.speaker: STREET CANVASSER
dialogues.text: Hi! Do you have a minute to save the polar bears? Billi stares blankly, annoyed by the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really wanna say something snarky, but I used to have your job.

dialogues.speaker: STREET CANVASSER
dialogues.text: (still smiling) So you know how important it is to support us!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I know your job sucks. Suddenly sympathetic, Billi stops.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (on phone) [Hold on, Nai Nai...] She pulls out her wallet. All she has is a dollar. She ha it to the stranger, who eyes it cynically.

dialogues.speaker: STREET CANVASSER
dialogues.text: Lemme guess, you got fired?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (feigns being offended) I quit! (beat, with a laugh) Cuz I was about to get fired! Billi and the canvasser share a laugh before Billi return her attention to Nai Nai.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Sorry, Nai Nai.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (What was that?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (Nothing. Just um... a friend...] Another announcement blares through the hospital speakers

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Hey, Nai Nai, what is that? What’s going on?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s nothing. I’1l call you back later, OK?] Nai Nai’s abruptness catches Billi slightly off-guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, OK...

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’1l call you back granddaughter! I promise I’1l1 call you back!]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: OK. [Call me la...] The line clicks before Billi can finish. It’s odd, but Bi shrugs it off and descends into the subway station. INT. THE PEOPLE’S HOSPITAL, CT SCAN MACHINE - DAY The bed slides out of the machine. A RADIOLOGIST helps Na Nai sit up.

dialogues.speaker: RADIOLOGIST
dialogues.text: [You can get dressed. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Where's my sister?]

dialogues.speaker: RADIOLOGIST
dialogues.text: [She’s with the doctor. ] INT. THE PEOPLE’S HOSPITAL, DOCTOR WU'S OFFICE - DAY Little Nai Nai sits alone across from DOCTOR WU. Though w don't hear their conversation, Little Nai Nai absorbs wha clearly terrible news. INT. THE PEOPLE’S HOSPITAL, HALLWAY - DAY Little Nai Nai is overwhelmed with grief, but there’s no for this. Her mind races. Then, with a deep breath, she m her decision. Yes, it’s clear what she must do. INT. THE PEOPLE’S HOSPITAL, WAITING ROOM - DAY Little Nai Nai approaches her distressed sister in the waiting room. She musters up a believable smile.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (OK, let's go.] Her voice is light and bright.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Did you talk to the doctor?]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Yep. You're in full health. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Really? What about the CT scan? What about the spots they saw before? ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It's all clear. Turned out to be nothing. Just... benign shadows. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Benign shadows? What's that mean?]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (shrugs nonchalantly) [That's just what the doctor said.] Nai Nai seems uncertain as she looks at her sister’s beam smile. Little Nai Nai helps her stand, still radiating wi optimism. As they leave the hospital, Nai Nai seems sufficiently convinced.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (prelap) «++. and one day the wife goes out of town. When she returns, her husband greets her right away, and he says, ‘honey your cat is dead.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAIYAN WANG (late 50’s), also known as DAD, smiles with s assurance as family and friends anticipate the rest of hi joke. Billi watches her father adoringly, sipping brandy around remains of their dinner.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: The wife gets very upset, you know? She says to her husband, how can you be so insensitive? You just tell me so abruptly like this? Despite his slight Chinese accent, Haiyan's a natural storyteller.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Her husband is you know, confused! He says to his wife... OK, how do you want me to tell you in the future? She says, “You have to not be so direct. It’s too sudden. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to, you know, be more gentle in delivering the news. For example, ease me in with something like ‘Listen, honey... your cat... it got on the roof...’” A few scattered chuckles from the table. JIAN LU, also kn as MOM (late 50's), enters with plates of cake.

dialogues.speaker: KATHY
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh, I’m stuffed. I don’t know if I have room for dessert. Haiyan is slightly irritated by the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Come, sit down...

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Come, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Where was I? Oh right... A few months go by. The wife goes out of town again. When she returns home, her husband’s there to greet her again. This time, he learned his lesson. When his wife comes through the door, he says, "Listen, honey, you know, your Mom... she got on the roof...” The table bursts into laughter. Even Billi and Jian chuck despite having heard the joke a million times. INT. BILLI’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Sound of KEYS in the dark as Billi lets herself in. She’s greeted by a LOUD CRASH - like a vase shattering. Billi d her mail, suddenly on guard. She’s scared, but ready to defend herself. Something FLIES overhead, knocking items off a shelf. Bil eyes dart across the room, spotting the culprit. A SMALL HOUSE BIRD on the windowsill. Billi’s eyes meet t bird's. Both parties are equally stunned. As she collects herself, she realizes all the windows are closed.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here? The bird stares up with its beady eyes. Billi opens a win to let it out. The traumatized bird doesn’t move.  Billi’s phone buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Hi Billi. Sorry I hung up earlier. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [That’s OK. What’s going on?]

dialogues.speaker: BETWEEN BILLI AND NAI NAI FOR PHONE CONVERSATION
dialogues.text: MR. LI (80's) shuffles past Nai Nai carrying a THERMOS of tea. Mr. Li is the kind of man that wears the same cap indoors, outdoors, even at weddings.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (genuine relief) (Nothing, nothing. I’m OK. You don’t have to worry, child. ] Nai Nai notices the trail of water following Mr. Li.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [It’s leaking! ] He’s oblivious. Nai Nai taps him, then shouts louder.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [It’s leaking! ] Mr. Li shuffles unhurriedly back into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [This old man! So careless! ] INT. BILLI’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Billi picks her mail off the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [You mean Mr. Li?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I never should've gotten together with him! ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Nai Nai! INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT —- MORNING As Mr. Li wipes up the water -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [It’s OK, he’s going deaf. He can’t hear me anyway. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (Why are you still with him?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (sighs) [It’s been so many years. We get by. Anyway, it’s better than living alone. At least there’s a live body in the house. Otherwise, when you get up to go to the bathroom, all you see are your own shadows. Listen, do you have a friend yet, my child? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I um... I have lots of friends. Nai Nai...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I mean a special friend. I worry about you on your own. In a big place like New York. ] INT. BILLI’S APARTMENT - EVENING Billi opens an envelope, pulls out a letter. A rejection the Guggenheim Foundation.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Billi? Is everything OK?] She's deflated, overwhelmed by the sense of failure.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I’m fine. I’m uh... I’m just tired. ] And suddenly, she does seem tired. Spiritually, that is.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [If you're tired, go to bed!] Billi nods to herself, too familiar with the way these th get lost in translation.

dialogues.speaker: OK...
dialogues.text: (beat) I love you Nai Nai...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lauf you, I lauf you! These are the only words Nai Nai knows. As broken as they sound, she says it with all her heart. Billi summons a we smile, just in case Nai Nai can hear her smile. She looks back at the windowsill. It's empty. The bird is gone. EXT. BILLI’S APARTMENT - DAY Billi marches out of her apartment holding an ENVELOPE. I a new day. She enters the laundromat just downstairs from apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi stands across from SHIRLEY (20's), folding stacks o laundry for customers. Her first-generation immigrant mot attends to customers nearby. She is the LAUNDROMAT OWNER landlord of the building).

dialogues.speaker: LAUNDROMAT OWNER
dialogues.text: (in another language) Late again! She’s always late, and she didn’t even pay last month! Billi looks between Shirley and her mother, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I wrote a couple pieces for this stupid web company and they screwed me on the payment, but look it’s all here.

dialogues.speaker: SHIRLEY
dialogues.text: For what month?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (confused) This one? May?

dialogues.speaker: SHIRLEY
dialogues.text: And what happened to April’s rent? My mom says you didn’t pay April yet. Billi is blind-sided as she realizes her error.

dialogues.speaker: SHIRLEY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know if you moved out, we could double the rent right now?  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi steps outside, realizes she’s still holding her laundry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi bursts through the door carrying the laundry.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Ma! Ba! Hello?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Shhh! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I've been calling, why didn’t you guys pick up?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: We busy. Have you eaten? I’1l make you some wontons. As Jian heads to the kitchen, Billi heads into the laundr room and puts clothes into the washer.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what, you broke? That’s why you come. I know you... You need money, right? Billi tries to deflect with humor.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: No, I just love an excuse to come see you.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: What’s going to happen to you? Are you always going to live like this?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Poor but sexy? I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Why you not save? You should change your expensive lifestyle!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Seriously, Mom. If you’re gonna give me shit every time I come home, I won’t come back anymore!  11.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Lower your voice. Dad’s sleeping!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: It's six o'clock. What’s wrong with him?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. He’s just resting.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Is he OK? Jian turns away from Billi and grabs frozen wontons from freezer. Her body language is evasive.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: He’s fine. We just very busy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Doing what? What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (lets out a sigh) Hao Hao’s getting married, so we have to go to China.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What? Since when? Didn’t he just start dating this girl a few months ago? Jian doesn’t respond, intently focused on chopping scalli

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can’t go to China right now, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: You don’t have to go.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: He’s my only cousin, shouldn’t I be there?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: No one expects you to go. Billi considers this suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: You think he knocked her up? Jian silently continues cooking.  12.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: How many wontons you want?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Um... Five.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Only five? That's not enough.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Then make a dozen.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: I think ten's good. Billi looks around - the house is eerily quiet. Something not right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi stares at the closed door. The light is on inside. knocks gently and opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haiyan sits on the edge of the bed, facing away from Bill

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Dad? His stillness, his silence - it’s eerie.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Did you and Mom get in a fight? Haiyan fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you been drinking? More silence. Terror.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you please talk to me? You're scaring me. Billi looks up to see Jian at the door.  13.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's going on? More silence. Billi’s insides are shrieking.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (raises her voice) Something's going on! Just tell me what's going on!

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (dry, to-the-point) Nai Nai's dying. She has lung cancer. It's stage four. Billi’s heart drops. She collapses onto the bed, sitting beside her father.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What? I just spoke to her, she didn’t say anything...

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: She doesn’t know yet. Billi’s mind races.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: How long does she have?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Doctor says three months, but you never know. Could be faster. Billi reels.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I need to call her...

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: No, Billi...

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I need to see her!

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: You can't do that. Haiyan puts aside his own grief momentarily. His words ar measured.  14.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She doesn’t know... And the family thinks it’s better not to tell her. So you can’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. She needs to know, right?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: There’s nothing they can do, so everyone decided it’s better not to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Why is that better?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Chinese people have a saying. When people get cancer, they die... Billi squints - what the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: -.. it's not the cancer that kills them. It's the fear.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What about the wedding? Jian joins her family on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: That was your Dad’s idea. If everyone rushed back to see her right now, she would wonder why.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: So you're throwing a fake wedding to lie to her?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: It’s an excuse for everybody to see her.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: When were you planning on telling me all of this? We're back to silence.  15.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (accusatory) How could you let me find out like this?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (defensive) How should I have told you? ‘Oh, your grandma’s on the roof? This doesn’t get a laugh, but Jian wasn’t expecting one.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I need to go see her...

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: You can’t.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Everyone thinks it’s better if you don’t go. Look at you. You can’t hide your emotions! Nai Nai will know right away!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I need to say goodbye. What if she dies and I don’t get a chance to say goodbye? The very thought of this makes Billi break down. Tears st down her face.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: You can go later. If you go right now you’ll give it away. You can’t help it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi stares out the window, past her own reflection, her grief apparent. Her laundry bag sits beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lit candles on a birthday cake. Everyone sings ‘happy birthday’ for their friend TONY. Billi’s mind is clearly elsewhere, even as she sings along. Her mother’s right - she’s no good at hiding her emotions  16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ELDERLY CHINESE WOMAN waits for her train across the tracks on the opposite platform. As Billi watches her, sh fights back emotions. As the train arrives, we see Billi’s grief transform into determination. She knows she must go. As the train whisks the elderly woman away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sea of Chinese faces. The ceiling is low, the floors ar glossy white marble. It takes a few moments before we spo Billi in the crowd. CHINESE VOICES echo around her. Billi gets shoved into a stranger. As a reflex, Billi say ‘I’m sorry’ in English. The stranger responds with a flur of Chinese. Billi reacts, trying to orient herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of TAXI HUSTLERS target Billi, invading her perso space. They inundate her with questions: “Do you need a taxi?” “Where are you going?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi stares out the window. Construction cranes dot the skyline, wide streets interrupted by the skeletal frames unfinished buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DRIVER honks repeatedly as he pulls down a narrow all Pedestrians and rickshaw peddlers make way for the car to pass. EXT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT - DAY The taxi pulls up to a complex of PEACH BUILDINGS. Billi gets out. She stares up at the looming building, no sure she’s prepared for the challenge she’s about to face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi climbs the stairs. The narrow staircase is dimly li a single bulb. She KNOCKS. We immediately hear barking. A Billi waits, the automatic light goes off, leaving her in dark for a few brief moments.  17. Mr. Li opens the door, letting out a shaft of cold fluorescent light from inside the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LI
dialogues.text: [Who's that?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (Mr. Li? It’s me, Billi.]

dialogues.speaker: MR. LI
dialogues.text: [Who? ] Mr. Li shouts his words, as one does when they’re losing their hearing, and perhaps even their mind.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Billi!

dialogues.speaker: MR. LI
dialogues.text: (Billi? What are you doing here? Come in, come in!]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (peering inside) [Nai Nai?] INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS As Billi moves into the living room, everyone reacts. Nai Nai, Haiyan, Jian. There’s also UNCLE HAIBIN (early 60's), distinguished gre with black-rimmed glasses. AUNTIE LING (60), quiet but shrewd. The pimple-faced and sheepish cousin is HAO HAO (early 20 ‘on the brink of tears’ is his eternal state of being. AI is his sweet but confused Japanese bride.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Billi? Oh my god, Billi’s here! ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Why'd you come?

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [What are you doing here? We all thought you weren’t coming! ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: How'd you get here? They talk AT her, all at once. Nai Nai is the only one wh seems pleased by this surprise. In fact, she’s overjoyed.  18.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Billi! Billi! What are you doing here you stupid child?] Nai Nai approaches Billi, analyzing her.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Let me look at you. Oh you’re not that skinny! Your Mom said you got skinny, but you’re not that skinny! ] Nai Nai embraces Billi. Billi’s throat swells shut. Her m quivers as tears flood to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Oh my granddaughter! Why didn’t you tell me you were coming? I've been trying to call you all week! ] A deer in headlights, Billi doesn’t speak, as if the secr would spill out if she opened her mouth. Family members observe her carefully, exchanging looks of concern. Nai Nai kisses her all over her face. Billi fights for control of her emotions.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Your mother said you were too busy to come! ] Billi opens her mouth and still, nothing comes out. Anticipation lingers in the air.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [What’s wrong with you? Why aren't you talking? ] Billi looks at her family, then back at Nai Nai. She swal hard. After a few long beats -

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I missed you.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Sure, but your work comes first. You shouldn’t have come if you're so busy. How’d you get here? Did you fly?] Billi musters a smile.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (No, I swam...]  19. Nai Nai laughs and slaps her on the butt. The tension beg to subside.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: You should’ve called. Nai Nai pats Billi's butt as they all head back to the co

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Silly child. This butt. This butt never changes! I’ve always loved this little round butt. Come sit!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A meat pie fries in the pan. Jian is at the stove as MRS. (40's) chops veggies and Little Nai Nai kneads dough. Billi peers in and hugs Little Nai Nai.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Little Nai Nai...]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Billi! You must be starving. I'm making your favorite - meat pies! It's your favorite, right? I remember it's your favorite. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Looks great...] As Mrs. Gao crosses.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Billi, this is Mrs. Gao.]

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GAO
dialogues.text: You’re the granddaughter! You came home too! ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Last time you were here, we still had Ms. Jin, right?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Ms. Jin? I remember Mrs. Ma?]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Mrs. Ma was four maids ago! Has it been that long since you’ve been back? ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi turns her attention to Jian, who stands over a fryi pan, giving her the cold shoulder. Billi bear hugs her mo from behind.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Stop fooling around! The oil's hot!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Don’t be mad, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: How you buy ticket here? Credit card, right?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. It's all fine, Mom. Look at my face. Look. Billi gives her the widest possible smile. Jian stifles a chuckle, too proud to give in. She feigns stoicism and sh a plate of meat pies into Billi's hands.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Go put these on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family eats, making small talk about the food. Billi scans the table, watching everyone devour meat pies. Nai Nai beams at the sight of the entire family around th table.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s been far too long since we've all been united like this.]

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE LING
dialogues.text: [What's it been? 20 years?]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Haiyan left China 25 years ago. And you guys left for Japan soon after. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [That's a long time. ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Time flies...] Mrs. Gao comes out with a plate of piping hot meat pies.  21.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GAO
dialogues.text: [These are hot. Eat these fresh ones! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Look at these two wonderful grandchildren of mine! ] Nai Nai playfully touches Billi and Hao Hao.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You see... my granddaughter is very strong. Independent. Not someone who just follows everyone else. ] Billi swallows.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Hao Hao was always a sensitive child, but look at him now. All grown up and getting married! I've been looking forward to this day for a long time. ]

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE LING
dialogues.text: [Too bad neither of them speak Chinese very well! ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [Hao Hao’s Chinese is fine. He’s just being shy. Hao Hao, talk to Nai Nai in Chinese! ] Everyone stares at Hao Hao. He reluctantly obeys, speakin slowly in his broken Chinese.

dialogues.speaker: HAO HAO
dialogues.text: [Nai Nai... We don’t need a big wedding banquet. We just came to spend time with you. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Don’t be ridiculous! You guys came back home to get married. We must have a proper wedding banquet. ]

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE LING
dialogues.text: [Let’s just keep it small. We don’t need to go overboard. ]  22.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Stop it! Everything’s already booked and I sent out invitations last week! My only grandson's getting married, we can’t look cheap! J] Little Nai Nai picks at her food. Everyone turns their fo to the food, chewing intently. Hao Hao is, quite reliably the brink of tears. Nai Nai suddenly notices Billi’s untouched meat pie.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (accusatory) [Why aren't you eating?] Billi stares down at her plate, unable to work up an appetite.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (I’m not hungry. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [How can you not be hungry? You've been traveling for 24 hours. Eat, eat. ] Nai Nai picks up the meat pie and feeds it to Billi. Alwa child in her grandmother’s eyes, Billi takes a reluctant bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi closes the door. She lets out a breath as she sits the toilet - a moment of refuge. On the wall in front of her is a poster of a chubby, over cheerful baby. Underneath, in Chinese, it reads: They all say I'm adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passing Nai Nai’s bedroom, Billi notices details of her simple life: the neatly-made bed, framed photos of Billi surround the room. In the next bedroom, Mr. Li shuffles around loudly in his slippers. He hacks up a loogie. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, DINING TABLE - NIGHT Billi returns to the table in a daze. Nai Nai turns to lo at her with concern.  23.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? ] The threat of being exposed lingers in the air.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I’m fine. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: It's probably the jet-lag. Come, I’1ll take you to the hotel. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Hotel? Why can't I stay here? I always stay here. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: With so many people visiting, it's easier if everyone stays at a hotel. It’s very close.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Don't worry, it's an excellent hotel. It’s brand new. ] Billi swallows her disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go get some rest. We have a lot to do the next couple days before the wedding. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family’s eyes linger on her, menacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi and Uncle Haibin walk side by side in awkward silen They pass street vendors wrapped in smoke and incandescen lighting, selling meat skewers off their grills.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [Nai Nai is very sick, you know?] He speaks in an eerily calm, matter-of-fact tone. Not sur the question is rhetorical, Billi answers.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I know. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [Nai Nai herself doesn't know. We're not going to tell her.]  24.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I know. Dad told me. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (not listening) [She doesn't have long left. We got several opinions already. I also spoke to a doctor in Japan. A cancer specialist. ] Billi stares straight ahead, unengaged. This doesn’t dete Uncle Haibin. UNCLE HAIBIN (CONT’D) I got her some medicine. It was expensive. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (hopeful) From the Japanese doctor? ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly) From the internet. ] Billi is at a loss for words. More awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nai Nai... she loves you so much, you know? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I know. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: You and Hao Hao spent every summer with her and grandpa until you moved to the US. But you were very little then, so you probably don’t remember. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I remember. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [She doesn’t know. So you have to be very careful not to tell her.] It feels like he’s testing her. Billi’s patience wears th She raises her voice.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I know! Dad already told me! ]  25. Like a broken record, Uncle Haibin’s tone remains consist

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: e oesn now a ing. She d 'tk thing Billi relinquishes with a sigh. As they continue on, thei repetitious dialogue falls into pace with their walking.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I know. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [We’re not planning on telling her. J

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I know. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [No matter how sad you feel, you cannot say anything. ] Billi stares ahead as they head into a brightly lit commercial district.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I know. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi and Uncle Haibin stand across from MICHAEL (late 20 the hotel manager.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (What do you mean the elevator broke? Isn't this a newly opened hotel? ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: [We're working on it. Come come, I'll carry this. ] A group of lively BUSINESSMEN and MISTRESSES walk in. Bil studies them - clearly in the hotel for a different reaso

dialogues.speaker: BUSINESSMAN
dialogues.text: [We want the same room as last time. ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (I'll check for you. ] Michael finds their key for them.  Billi nods 26.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (to Billi) [You're OK, right? I'm gonna head back. Get some sleep. ] and he leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi follows Michael upstairs. Several flights later, sh stops to catch her breath. This makes

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Are we almost there? ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: Almost there! It's not much higher. ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you visiting from abroad? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Yes. ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: From where? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: America. ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: America? You don't look American. ] Billi pause, but she’s used to it.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you here for?] Billi debates which answer to give him. She decides on th lie.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: A wedding. ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (beat) Who’s getting married? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: My...] cousin. (remembers the Chinese) ‘Tang di.’

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: [Oh your cousin. He’s also from America? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [No, they live in Japan. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael lets Billi into her room. INT. HOTEL BEST, BILLI’S ROOM - NIGHT Billi surveys the room as Michael drops off her bag.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: (Japan?! What are they doing in Japan? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I don’t know. My uncle’s an artist. He paints. ] The odd-patterned carpet, the strange paintings, the wallpaper - it all clashes, yet somehow, it works.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: And what does your father do in America? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: He’s a translator, do you have water? For drinking? ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: You can use the boiler. ] Michael points to an ELECTRIC BOILER.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So tell me, what’s better? China or America? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Uh... they’re different. ] Billi tries to usher him towards the door, but he continu to linger.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: What do you mean different? It must be much nicer over there. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [It’s just... I don’t know, different. ]

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: [But you’re probably more used to America, right?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: {I guess...] She continues to inch him out the door.

dialogues.speaker: MICHAEL
dialogues.text: [Well let me know if you need anything else. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (K thanks. Bye. ] INT. HOTEL BEST, BILLI’S ROOM - LATER Billi fills the boiler. She sits on the edge of the bed, literally waiting for the water to boil.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (prelap)

dialogues.speaker: HA
dialogues.text: EXT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT —- MORNING Nai Nai swings her arms, hitting herself all over her bod Her face beams, her eyes sparkle. She’s full of life and Billi seems like a drag in comparison.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Come Billi! Do it with me! It’s good for you!] Billi does a weak imitation of Nai Nai’s exercise.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (No, stronger. HA! It clears out all the bad toxins. Then you inhale, take in lots of fresh oxygen. HA! You do it. You also have to slap yourself to get the circulation going. (demonstrates slapping) Slap your arms. Slap your legs. Slap your back like this... Try it!]  29. Humoring her grandmother, Billi obeys her orders and laug at herself. For a moment, she forgets the circumstances o her visit.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Good! Bigger! From your gut. ] For a moment, they revel in the joy of slapping and shout INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, STAIRWELL - MORNING Nai Nai’s knuckles turn white from her grip on the railin pulling herself up one step at a time. It pains Billi to see this. She tries to help.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’m alright, I got it. I come down by myself every morning. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Doesn’t that hurt your legs?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Even so, I have to come down to exercise. It’s the reason I’m so healthy. Even at my age!] Billi swallows, unable to contradict her. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, DINING TABLE —- MORNING Billi and Mrs. Gao set out Chinese breakfast foods. The door bell rings and Chen YuPing (40's) waltzes in. (W refer to her as GU GU, which is Chinese for Aunt). She ha the hip confident style of someone much younger and exude attitude of success.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: (Billi! I heard you came! ] Gu Gu's son LITTLE BAO (8) trails in behind her, playing his iPhone. Bao is what the Chinese call a little emperor pampered and well-fed.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You remember Bao, right? Bao! Say hi to the big sister! ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Little Bao, you've gotten so big!]  30.

dialogues.speaker: BAO
dialogues.text: (barks ) It's not Little Bao! I’m just called Bao! ] Nai Nai calls everyone to attention.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Alright, alright hurry up and eat breakfast! We have a big day ahead! ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: Have you taken your pills?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: I'll take them later. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: You have to remember to take them every day, or there's no point! Where are they?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Next to my bed. Come you guys! Eat before the food gets cold!]

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE LING
dialogues.text: Ma, you sit!] As everyone finally takes their seat -

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: OK, listen to me all of you. I know everyone's excited to see me, but let's not forget why we're all here. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furtive glances around the table. Nai Nai gestures to Hao and Aiko.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [The wedding is the big event.] As if they really had forgotten, they all nod a little to enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (mutters unconvincingly) [Yes... that's right. The wedding is the big event.]  31. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER As Jian helps Mrs. Gao clean up, Nai Nai sidles up to her

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Jian, something's off about Haiyan on this trip. Have you noticed? His face is all puffy and discolored. He seems very unhappy. ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [He's fine, Ma.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [He just looks so tired. Is he still drinking? You can’t let him drink. Alcohol can ruin a person. I know so many men around here who have drank themselves to death. ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [He barely drinks at home anymore. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Is everything OK between you two?]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [Everything's fine. We're fine.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I know you guys have had your issues in the past...]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (defensive) [It's got nothing to do with us. We're doing great! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You shouldn't have him work so much. It’s too much pressure for one person to support your entire family...] Was that a jab at her?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [I told him to close the office and retire, but he refuses! He feels useless at home if he has nothing to do. He loves being surrounded by people who need him - clients always coming to him... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: oh Mr. Wang, help me with this, help me with that. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (nods ) [Well it’s also good to have something to do. Being idle can be bad for your health. He just doesn’t know how to take care of himself. You have to think about him more. Give him lots of medicine. Let’s put it this way - if he’s not well, you can’t live well either. Right?] INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, DINING TABLE - MORNING As Nai Nai rejoins the table, she clocks Haiyan again. Something’s definitely not right. Uncle hands her a couple pills. Nai Nai clocks Billi’s concerned look.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [They're just vitamins. Your uncle bought them from Japan. He says they’re expensive so they must be good. Japanese people know how to take care of themselves! ] Mr. Li gets up from the table silently.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE LING
dialogues.text: [Uncle Li, you’re done eating?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Don’t mind him. That’s how he is! He eats and leaves. He doesn’t care about anything that doesn’t concern him! ] Mr. Li is immune to Nai Nai’s insults. Nai Nai tries to s food. Everyone yells: Sit down! Serve yourself! Hurry up eat!

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (I want to talk to you all about something. If anyone asks, none of you are to say that Hao Hao and his bride have only been dating three months. ]  33.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE LING
dialogues.text: [Ma, I already told you, Aiko's not pregnant. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Doesn’t matter! You know how people think! I don’t want everybody talking behind our backs. If anyone asks, just say they’ve been dating 6 months. ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) [Why not just say a year then?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Good idea. A year sounds better. The wedding banquet is in three days. We have so much to do. I need someone to come see the banquet hall with me.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I‘ll go.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: You don’t need to come. You won’t be much help anyway. ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Ma, I can come. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: No you need to rest! Look at your face - it’s not right!]

dialogues.speaker: HAIBIN
dialogues.text: Why don’t you stay home and rest, Ma? I‘ll go check on the banquet hall. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: You don’t even know who to talk to! I have to go myself. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What can I do, Nai Nai?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Nothing. You don’t look great either, must still be the jet lag.]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [What if I take them to the massage parlor? ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [That’s a great idea! ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Nai Nai I want to come with you.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (No, you guys go relax. You better not get sick before the wedding! ] Nai Nai piles more food on Billi's plate, then shoves a doughy cruller in her own mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nai Nai and Uncle Haibin stand across from the WEDDING COORDINATOR in an empty banquet hall. Nai Nai is visibly upset.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s not right! I ordered meal set one! When I booked the wedding, you guys told me meal set one would come with lobster. That’s what you said. Now you act like you don’t know anything about it?]

dialogues.speaker: WEDDING COORDINATOR
dialogues.text: [I really don’t know anything about that. I was told it’s crab, but I can check with the chef. (screams ) Little Ping! Little Ping!] LITTLE PING, a young cook dressed in a tall chef’s hat wa from a nap at a nearby table. WEDDING COORDINATOR (CONT’D) [Go get the chef! ] Little Ping drags himself into the kitchen. WEDDING COORDINATOR (CONT’D) (Why don’t you look at the alcohol options in the meantime. We have baijiu, red wine, white wine, beer...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [We also have champagne. ]  35.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (Champagne? What champagne? ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Your brother brought it! He didn’t tell you? He got several cases! It’s from France. Looks very nice and expensive! ] Something about this rubs Uncle Haibin the wrong way.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (frowning) [Chinese people aren’t accustomed to drinking champagne! Get the baijiu.] The BANQUET CHEF approaches -—

dialogues.speaker: WEDDING COORDINATOR
dialogues.text: (Chef, Mrs. Zhao says she was told that meal set one would include lobster, not crab. ]

dialogues.speaker: BANQUET CHEF
dialogues.text: [It’s crab, not lobster. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [What kind of scam is this? It’s three days before the wedding, we already paid a deposit and you make this kind of a change without telling us!]

dialogues.speaker: BANQUET CHEF
dialogues.text: [I don’t know anything about that. I was told we're serving crab. ] Agitated, Nai Nai coughs and collapses onto a chair. Uncl Haibin rushes to her side.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (Ma! Don’t get all worked up, crab is great! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’m fine. I just need to rest a moment . ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Numb with anguish, Billi and Haiyan sit waiting, dressed oversized spa pajamas.  36.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: So what's going on with the fellowship?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: You still haven't heard anything?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: When are they going to let you know?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (irritated) I don’t know Dad!

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: How’s your money? Can you afford this trip? Do you need help?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Before Billi can continue, Gu Gu approaches, also in paja She's accompanied by a MASSAGE PARLOR RECEPTIONIST.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [All set, let’s go.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi, Gu Gu and Haiyan walk down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Sis, you’re too generous. ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [You’re family. It’s so rare for you guys to come home. Let’s just all relax so we can be happy in front of Nai Nai.]

dialogues.speaker: MASSAGE PARLOR RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: [What kind of treatment would you like, ‘mei nu’?] Gu Gu clocks Billi’s confusion.  37.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [She’s from America. Her Chinese isn’t great. Just give her the full body massage. ]

dialogues.speaker: MASSAGE PARLOR RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: [Cupping too?]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [The whole package. ]

dialogues.speaker: MASSAGE PARLOR RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: [You want the same thing, ‘mei nu’?]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [I don’t need cupping. ] Gu Gu speaks too fast for Billi to understand. She turns her father for a translation -

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What’s ‘mei nu’?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: It means ‘beauty’.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Always beauty, beauty. They call everyone that in China these days. Old or young, beautiful or ugly, everyone’s a beauty! It’s so stupid. ] The MASSAGE PARLOR RECEPTIONIST turns to Haiyan.

dialogues.speaker: MASSAGE PARLOR RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: [Sir, what about you?]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (jokes ) [Oh you can call me beauty. I don’t mind. ]

dialogues.speaker: MASSAGE PARLOR RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (doesn’t crack a smile) [I meant what kind of treatment would you like, sir? May I recommend our bath and massage package? The tub is filled with herbs and you can soak in it.] Gu Gu and Billi watch Haiyan. He's indecisive.  38.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (to Gu Gu) [What do you think?]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Why are you asking me? It's your massage! Do you want to soak in a tub? ] Haiyan contemplates this carefully, as if the right treat might cure his grief.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Can you show me the tub?] The receptionist leads Haiyan down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi paces anxiously. Gu Gu clocks this and tries to che her up.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: (teasing) Hey Billi. Do you know why they separated your Dad from us?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Why? ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: You really don’t know? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What? }

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: (smirks ) "Hit the airplane'.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Hit the airplane? ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: You don't know this phrase? You're not married yet. I shouldn’t tell you this stuff.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What’s it mean?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gu Gu covertly demonstrates a jerking-off motion, gigglin  39.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [You know, it shoots so high he could hit an airplane! ] Despite herself, Billi laughs. Haiyan appears at the door

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [The bath looks nice. I think I'll do that.] Billi and Gu Gu burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (confused) What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on her stomach, Billi stares down at the masseuse's feet in nylon stockings inside white pumps. She cringes a the masseuse lights a cup on fire and places it on her ba

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [It hurts! Gu Gu, you said it was a massage. ] BILLI’S MASSEUSE [A little pain is normal. Otherwise it doesn’t work. Just relax. ] Billi turns to Gu Gu, who’s absorbed in her cell phone wh getting a foot massage.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Gu Gu... Don’t you think we should tell Nai Nai?] Gu Gu’s attention stays on her phone.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Tell her? What for?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [What if she has things she wants to take care of?]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: (matter-of-factly) [She doesn’t have anything like that... Ow!] Gu Gu yanks her foot back from the masseuse.  40.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (That hurt, what was that?] GU GU’S MASSEUSE [That’s your stress point. Have you been anxious lately? You must try to relax. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [But... what if she wants to say goodbye? ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Say goodbye? That’s so painful! What’s the point of that?] Billi winces with pain, her entire back covered with cups Gu seems very pragmatic and matter-of-fact.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You see her for yourself. She seems fine, right? Just like a normal person...] Billi realizes this is valid.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [If you tell her, you’1l ruin her good mood. ] Billi considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aiko and Hao Hao pose in front of a backdrop, dressed in elaborate wedding attire. They're as stiff as the plastic bride and groom toppers on a cake. A PHOTOGRAPHER adjusts the couple's positions.

dialogues.speaker: PHOTOGRAPHER
dialogues.text: [Get a little closer. Even closer. ] The cake toppers don’t know where to put their hands. It’ all very forced and awkward.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Get closer! What's wrong with this girl? Can't you look like a normal couple in love?] Nai Nai instructs Aiko sternly in Chinese. (Aiko doesn’t understand Chinese).  4l.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Put your head on his shoulder. Put your hand around her. And smile! ] Aiko looks to Hao Hao for a translation, but he’s too bus figuring out how to smile. Nai Nai directs her disapprovi look to Billi.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [That girl is so unaffectionate. Nothing like our family. I have to yell at her just to hug him or put her cheek against his! Makes me wonder what they do in the bedroom when I'm not there! ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [She seems really sweet, Nai Nai.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I don’t like her. She’s dumb. She doesn’t understand anything! ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [She doesn’t understand, because she doesn’t speak Chinese...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [No, it’s because she’s dumb. ] On cue, something on set falls, making Aiko trip. Everyon reacts. Against the chaos of the photo shoot, Nai Nai calmly shif her attention to her granddaughter. Billi is clearly the better bride in her eyes - if only she’d find someone to marry.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Look at you. Smart. Beautiful. You should have someone take care of you. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I take care of myself, Nai Nai.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The conversation is seamless, but in the background, the bride and groom pose against a different backdrop.  42.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You’re still young. But as you get older, it’s good for you to have someone to take care of you.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Does Mr. Li take care of you?] Nai Nai looks away. She takes a beat before answering.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s also good to be independent. A woman needs to be self- sufficient. ] The woman’s got a response to everything. Billi laughs as Nai presses her cheek against Billi’s. Meanwhile, on set, Aiko stumbles in her impossibly high h and Auntie Ling rushes to her assistance.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Stupid child. You are too lovable. I’ll never forget when your parents brought you to my house the summer before you turned two. You were so small, so skinny. You had that horrible nanny who stole your eggs and she’d take you all over the city and only feed you popsicles. Do you remember this?] Billi shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Why did she steal my eggs?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Eggs were rationed back then. Your parents saved theirs so you could have at least one a day.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi considers this sacrifice, internalizing the complic mix of love and guilt.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You poor thing, I felt so bad for you. You had terrible digestion, from too much dampness trapped inside, so you’d have diarrhea all the time, everywhere... all over the floor. ]  43.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I’m sorry I pooped on your floor. ] And she does seem sorry. Behind her, the young couple hol flutes of fake champagne for a photo.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It wasn’t your fault! I told your mother to leave you with me so I could fix you. Spending that year with me, you became fatter, the color returned to your cheeks. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [You fixed me! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You were just a happy child. Everyone loved you. You were so open, always smiling. My child, there’s been so much going on this trip, we haven’t been able to talk much. ] On cue again, a LOST BRIDE waddles onto set from a back d Suddenly, there are two brides against the backdrop, caus momentary confusion. The BRIDE HANDLER immediately pulls back out, apologizing. Nai Nai is unfazed by all this, her attention fixed on Bi

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [This event is very important. There will be a lot of relatives and friends who haven’t seen you since you were little. I know you have a lot on your mind, but you must still be generous in spirit. Be courteous! ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nai Nai takes Billi's hand as they walk through a Garden Eden setting. They walk past fake tropical trees and a ra peacock.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [When you see people, you should loudly say 'hello auntie! Hello uncle!' Don't be 'nio nio ne ne'.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: ['Nio nio ne ne?’]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You don't know ‘nio nio ne ne’? You know... like this...] Nai Nai demonstrates the phrase comically. Billi chuckles

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [That's 'nio nio ne ne'. Very selfish, closed off. Nobody likes that kind of person. Promise me. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: OK...[I promise. ] Nai Nai affectionately pats her butt.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [When you get married, I'll throw you an even bigger wedding banquet! ] We stay on Billi’s face as this lands on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family gathers around a large round table cove with food. There are a few new family members including G (Gu Gu’s husband) and two cousins - SUN AO (early 40’s) a his wife NICO. Gu Gu pours beer for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Come, let’s toast. Welcome home, welcome home! How rare it is for us all to be together. Just look at your mother’s face...] Everyone raises their glass and drinks. Sun Ao gleefully refills for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Sis, thank you for everything...] Gu Fu dismisses him playfully with a wave.

dialogues.speaker: GU FU
dialogues.text: [We're all one family. No need to talk about thanks. Come on, let’s all drink. ]  45.

dialogues.speaker: SUN AO
dialogues.text: [Let’s see who can handle their alcohol better, Americans or Chinese! ] Uncle Haibin lights up a cigarette. As he offers one to Haiyan, Billi intercepts -—

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [My dad quit.]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [Really?] Uncle Haibin looks at Haiyan in disbelief and Haiyan avoi eye contact.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Billi) [I don’t think so. I think he just told you that. ] Sun Ao sees that Nai Nai didn’t finish her beer.

dialogues.speaker: SUN AO
dialogues.text: (Auntie, don’t think you're excused! You also have to gan bei! ] Nai Nai laughs, and nods. She makes a show of emptying he glass. Her family cheers.

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: [Hey Billi, you ever think about moving back to China? A lot of foreigners are moving here to make money now! ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [How long would it take to make a million dollars in America? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (Um... a long time. ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Really? It’s very easy in China. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Money is not the most important. There are lots of things that money can’t buy.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Look at my granddaughter! She’s so wise! ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [But if you get rich, first you buy the things money CAN buy. Then you can also enjoy the free stuff money can't buy!] Jian is triggered by this.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [YuPing, if you can get rich in China, then why are you planning to send Bao to America for college?]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [For more opportunity...]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [What kind of opportunity? Money- making opportunity? After studying in America, maybe Bao also won't care about money. Just like Billi. She's got different values. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Mom, can you not talk about me?

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: (trying to make peace) [You guys don’t have to worry. When she becomes a big famous writer, she can make big money. You're investing in her talent! ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [So raising a kid is like playing the stock market? ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (to Dad) What’s that mean?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: They're saying you’re a stock investment and you'll make us rich.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: But I can’t expect that from you, right? You're a losing stock. Jian smiles at her own joke, but Billi isn’t amused. 46.  47.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [These American kids are only concerned with their own dreams. ]

dialogues.speaker: SUN AO
dialogues.text: [Nowadays, Chinese kids are that way too!]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [But in America, they actually have the freedom to pursue their dreams. Doesn’t matter if you’re rich or poor, everyone has the same opportunities. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: You're kidding right? You think everyone in America has equal opportunity?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [You know, the first year we moved to America, our friend Henry introduced us to an American church. The first time we went, we were really nervous, didn’t understand anything. After the service, we walked past the piano and Billi stood in front of it, staring. She reached her hand out and Haiyan stopped her. The pastor came over to introduce herself. Haiyan explained to the pastor that Billi used to study piano in China. She stopped after we moved and really missed it. We couldn't afford it. The pastor didn’t say anything, but came back moments later and handed me a key. She said, “This key opens every door on this property. Come anytime and Billi can play the piano.”]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Really? They really did that?]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [I didn’t speak English so I thought I misunderstood and Haiyan translated for me. I almost started crying. ]  48.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [They even got her a piano teacher for free. ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Look at that. That would never happen in China. America really is different, huh?]

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: [But China has China’s benefits! We're not totally useless. ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [Yea, the roast duck is still delicious! ] Jian’s the only one laughing at her own joke again.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Mom. That one church is not representative of all of America. We have so many problems - healthcare, guns, public education...

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (suddenly defensive) If you think China’s better, then why don’t you move here?

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [That’s enough. You listen to me! You can't go around criticizing your motherland. Don't any of you forget that you're still Chinese! ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (jokingly) [Well, technically, we're American. ] The Chinese family all glare at him.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (nervous smile) [I just mean that we're American citizens now. We hold American passports. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [That’s just a piece of paper. The blood in your veins is still Chinese! ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [I'll always be Chinese. No matter where I live or what passport I hold. ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [You all think the moon outside of China is rounder, but do you ever think about your mother? Having to grow old without her kids around. ] Haiyan and Haibin both grow quiet with guilt.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: OK OK, enough! Everyone’s home, let's talk about happy things! ] Jian’s got a bone to pick and she just won’t let it go.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: But YuPing, you say you still plan on sending Bao out of the country for college? ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: He won’t stay there. He’ll come back. ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: You can’t guarantee that. ] Gu Gu knows that Jian’s right.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But even with the risk that he won't return, you’d still send him out, right?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gu Gu swallows. The table is silent as everyone chews intently. Food is always there to fill the awkward spaces Sun Ao tries to change the subject.

dialogues.speaker: SUN AO
dialogues.text: [So um... how’s your piano Billi?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I don’t play anymore. ] What little air remains in the room is sucked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long hallway. The entire family marches back to their rooms, one after another. Billi lags behind.  50. Smoke lingers out of an open door in the hallway and she peers inside. A group of drunk middle-aged men smoke arou mahjong table, a few of them shirtless. Billi watches the women around them. One SEXY WOMAN catch Billi’s gaze. Their eyes lock, each caught by the other i their performative act. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT —- NIGHT Little Nai Nai, Mr. Li and Nai Nai walk through the front door. Nai Nai is coughing. Mrs. Gao attends to her.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Go home, I’m fine. ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You’re coughing a lot.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s probably the flu. I’1l be fine. Don’t mention it to anyone, I don’t want them to worry. ] Little Nai Nai nods.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Go on. Go upstairs. I’m fine. ] Little Nai Nai grapples quietly with the consequences of lie. With no other choice, she leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi takes her shirt off and examines her back in the mirror. It's covered with large round purple welts from t "ba guan" (cupping). INT. HOTEL BEST, BILLI’S ROOM - MORNING Billi wakes to voices echoing through the hallway. She op her eyes to find a SMALL HOUSE BIRD on the windowsill. It looks just like the one that got stuck in her apartment. Her eyes meet the bird’s. What does it mean? Shouting continues in the hallway and she gets up to investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Billi steps out of her room, Uncle Haibin rushes past.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (Hurry up, I’ll meet you downstairs! ]  51. Billi turns to see Haiyan getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Do you know how to get there?] Uncle Haibin holds his cell phone as Little Nai Nai’s voi shouts through the speakerphone.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s building 8!]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [OK auntie, I'll figure it out. Just get over there and we’ll meet you! ] Billi looks back and forth, caught in the middle of this crossfire.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [What’s going on?]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [Nai Nai went to the hospital. ] Hao Hao steps out of his room, still half asleep.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What happened?!

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Billi’s heart sinks as she and Hao Hao lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi, Hao Hao, Haiyan and Uncle Haibin are lost as they frantically try to orient themselves. INT. THE PEOPLE’S HOSPITAL, EXAM ROOM - MORNING Nai Nai sits on the exam table with Mrs. Gao by her side. Billi, Haiyan, Hao Hao and Uncle Haibin rush in, Nai Nai scrunches her face in annoyance.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Why did you all come?] She turns to Little Nai Nai.  52.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You told them? I told you not to say anything! You didn’t need to come! ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You come to the hospital by yourself while your sons are all here! If something happened and I didn’t tell them, they’d blame me!]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I didn’t come alone. Mrs. Gao brought me! ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Ma, you can’t just disappear without telling any of us!]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’1l go see where the doctor is...] As Little Nai Nai opens the door to leave, a group of doc rush past with a stretcher, another reminder of what’s ar the corner. Nai Nai clocks the fear in Billi’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’m fine! I just came to pick up some medicine. It’s not a big deal! ] Billi takes a seat beside Nai Nai. She takes her hand as rest of the family looks on.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [What medicine? ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I have this lingering cough from the last time I had a cold. I just wanted to see if there’s better antibiotics to help me heal faster. ] Billi grasps Nai Nai’s hand, brings it to her face. She t in the scent of her grandmother's skin, the feel of it on face. She kisses Nai Nai’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [I’m fine my child. ]  53. The words sit on the tip of Billi’s tongue. She knows she needs to tell her the truth.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [You’re not. Nai Nai...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You don’t need to worry about me. Anyway, I’m 80 years old. I’ve lived a long life. I’m not scared and you don’t have to be scared for me. I just want you to be successful and have a good life and I'll be satisfied. I know you’re worried, but I’m OK. Don’t worry. I'm fine. ] Before Billi can say anything else, Little Nai Nai enters with the young handsome DOCTOR SONG.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: (Mrs. Zhao. Let’s have a look.] He’s on autopilot, going through the motions of a routine exam. Little Nai Nai holds her breath. DOCTOR SONG (CONT’D) (Breathe, breathe, cough. You have some infection...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’m already on antibiotics but it’s not working! You gave me bad medicine. You have to change it. Give me a better one so I can feel better! ] Nai Nai gestures to Hao Hao.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [This is my grandson, he’s getting married in two days!]

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: [Ah. Congratulations. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Everyone came back for the wedding! This is my granddaughter. She’s from America. ] Doctor Song’s eyes widen with excitement as he turns his focus to Billi. He switches to English.  54.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: Oh, you visit from America! I went to school many years in the UK.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Oh. Cool. That's um...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: Where do you live?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: New York...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: I always want to visit New York City. Very beautiful city.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: It is... but listen... Do you know about my grandmother's condition? Haiyan clocks what's going on.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Billi, don’t...

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: What are you guys talking about?] Billi smiles broadly for Nai Nai'’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Oh Nai Nai, he studied in England so he speaks English! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Really? ]

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: It's true.] Nai Nai smiles at Dr. Song, clearly having her own agenda

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Doctor Song, let me ask you. Are you married? ]

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: (blushes ) Not yet.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [So handsome. A doctor. And you speak English. Not married? Impossible! ] Billi switches back to English. Nai Nai watches them, clueless.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: How bad is she? Tell me the truth.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: The cancer is quite advanced.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Don’t you think you should tell her?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: It’s complicated. In her situation, most families in China wouldn't tell her. When my grandmother had cancer, my family also didn’t tell her. Billi registers this with surprise.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Don’t you think it’s wrong to lie?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: It’s not really a lie if it’s meant for good.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: It’s still a lie.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: It’s a good lie. Billi doesn’t understand the idea of his good lie. Good f what?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: And how’s your grandmother?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: She passed away. A few months after she was diagnosed. This affects Billi, but Haiyan also registers this.  56. DOCTOR SONG (CONT’D) (to Nai Nai) [Mrs. Zhao, you had pneumonia a few months ago so I’m thinking this could be some residual infection in your lungs from that. We should do an X-ray to make sure the infection isn’t spreading. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [That’s not necessary! I just came in to change my medicine. Can’t you just give me a better brand of antibiotics? ]

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR SONG
dialogues.text: [We can change your medicine, but just as a precaution, let’s do an x- ray.]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Sis, since you insisted on coming and you're already here just do the X-ray!]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [You heard him, Ma. It’s just precautionary. ] Nai Nai looks to Haiyan for his opinion. He diverts his g to the ground. INT. THE PEOPLE’S HOSPITAL - DAY Nai Nai sits alone in a hospital gown awaiting her X-ray. has a coughing fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haiyan paces back and forth, carefully considering his wo

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Maybe it’s time we tell her.] Everyone looks up, as if betrayed.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [And we make some plans... like who's going to come back to stay with her when she’s sick.]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [We can make plans without telling her. J  57. Haiyan lets out a conflicted sigh.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [It’s just... in America, we would not make this kind of decision. We couldn't, really.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [It'd be...] (switches to English) Illegal. How do you say illegal?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Illegal. In America, this is illegal. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [This isn’t America. ] [I recommend...it’s not time yet.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [How do you know? ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I just know. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Don’t you think she'd be furious if she found out that we all knew and were keeping it from her?]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [How can she be mad when she did the same thing herself?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (What do you mean? ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (When your grandfather had cancer, your Nai Nai lied to him too. It wasn’t until he was very close to the end that she finally told him. She said, “Old timer, you have the same disease that took our prime minister.” He died three days later. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [So she did tell him. ]  58.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Yes, in the end she told him. She thought it'd be cruel to let him leave this world without knowing what got him. (beat) When your Nai Nai reaches that point, I’1l tell her too.] EXT. NAI NAI’S NEIGHBORHOOD - DAY The family unit makes their way back, past our familiar p buildings. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT —- AFTERNOON Close on ELLEN, a chihuahua whose white hair matches that the two Nai Nai’s. She whimpers.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: [Sing Ellen! Sing! Sing a song for us!]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Sing a song, Ellen, sing!] Under duress, Ellen begins to "sing" - yelping at the top her lungs. Everyone laughs. As the dog stops singing and the laughter dies down, they suddenly remember. We linger on each individual face - th smiles drop, replaced by silence filled with uncertainty fear. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, KITCHEN - NIGHT Jian, Little Nai Nai and Auntie Ling cook tirelessly, dripping with sweat. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS Uncle Haibin pours the remainder of a beer into Haiyan’s glass. They drink compulsively, surrounded by empty bottl Hao Hao and Aiko play a game on Aiko’s iPhone. Billi is at the piano. She hits a few keys. It’s out of t clashing with the cacophony of voices behind her. Nai Nai notices her sons’ empty beers.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Mr. Li, go get the Mao Tai we saved! ]  59. Jian rushes out of the kitchen in a panic.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [Ma, the wedding’s in two days and there will be a lot to drink. Maybe it’s best to save that bottle...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (What am I saving it for?]

dialogues.speaker: MR. LI
dialogues.text: [Where’s the Mao Tai again?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (In the bookshelf! ] Mr. Li goes to find the bottle. The sound of Billi’s pian continues to escalate, forcing Jian and Nai Nai to raise their voices.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [You know these two sons of yours. Once they start, they can’t stop. The doctor says Haiyan’s already got a fatty liver!] Mr. Li brings out the bottle and pours for Haiyan and Unc Haibin.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
