dialogues.text: [It’s rare for them both to come home. If they want to drink, let them drink! We’re celebrating! ] Suddenly, Billi breaks into a full impassioned piano piec (perhaps Liszt or Prokofiev). Everyone stops what they’re doing to watch, a little surprised. Billi’s fingers fly furiously. Expressing through music w she can’t express in life, Billi’s eyes flicker with rage As Billi finishes, everyone is stunned silent. To mask th awkwardness, Little Nai Nai claps enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Good! Oh my god, too good! ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Play another one. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [But play something happier...] Billi sits at the keys, raw with emotion.
The men stagger back to their rooms with the help of thei wives.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [I told you not to drink, you had to drink! Your mother’s always telling me to take care of you, but if she’s giving you booze she doesn’t worry about your health? Every time you drink you get drunk! J

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Mom, leave him alone.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (Who drank too much? I’m not drunk! My mom gave it to me. I drink with my Ma... I drink for my Ma...] INT. HOTEL BEST, JIAN & HAIYAN’S ROOM - NIGHT Billi watches as Jian removes Haiyan’s jacket in bed.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Grab me the water. Over there. Billi grabs the bottle. Jian brings the bottle to Haiyan’ mouth, forcing him to drink.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come. Help me remove his shoes. Billi and Jian undress Haiyan as he groans.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Nai Nai shouldn't be organizing this wedding.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: She enjoy it, so just let her do it!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: She's sick. She should be resting or in the hospital, not stressing about a fake wedding!

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: You don’t know your grandma as well as you think you do. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t you know, she loves to boss everyone around! Make her feel important and in control.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Mom...

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: It’s true! That’s why she hated staying at our house in America. Because she couldn’t tell anyone what to do. She see me and nothing I do is good enough for her but in America she couldn't say anything there because it was MY house. Jian becomes increasingly aggressive with undressing Haiy stripping him down to his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Stop it, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (suddenly defensive) What? [What did I do?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I know you've always had issues with her, but you need to drop it!

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: I don’t have issues with her. She has issues with me!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: She’s dying! Can’t you be a little more sensitive? Haiyan groans as their voices raise to a shout.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: What do you want from me? To scream and cry like you? You know, when my father died, I also sad... But I not act like you! When I went back to China for the funeral, everyone was watching me, all expecting me to fall apart! They think if I don’t cry, I don’t love my father.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: No one’s asking you to cry.  62.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Death is very personal. I don’t have to cry in front of everyone to prove anything! I don’t like to put you know... all my emotions on display, like I’m in a zoo! Here they think that’s the only way to grieve. By performing for everybody. Otherwise they think you're not respectful. You know, in China... they even hire professional crier just WAAAAAH screaming crying to show oh how sad they are. It’s ridiculous! I hate that! Billi can’t look at her mother. She is at a complete loss Prelap the sound of WAILING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A funeral procession is led by a melodramatic CRIER. Noth specifically indicates whether she’s professional or amat Nearby, the Wang family (including Gu Gu and Bao) gather around YE YE’S GRAVE. The tomb bears a PHOTO OF YE YE. They quickly set out fruit, eggs, bao zi (dumplings), bam wrapped sticky rice, and other offerings. Everyone talks each other in a lively manner. Despite being in a graveyard, the setting is full of life Nai Nai hands Hao Hao a bag of food.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Here, put these out. ] She hands Billi some bananas.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Give Ye Ye some bananas. He loved to eat bananas. ] Haiyan opens a bottle of Chinese baijiu. He pours it over Ye’s grave, then takes a drink himself.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Dad, I’m toasting to you.] Aiko and Hao Hao converse in Japanese over some tangerine

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Hurry up and set those out! ]  63. They put them on the grave.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [You have to peel them! ] Hao Hao picks the tangerines back up.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Do they need to be peeled? I don't think they need to be peeled. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Yes, yes. Peel them! Otherwise Ye Ye can't eat them! ] Haiyan hands Billi the bottle of baijiu. She takes a swig

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Hey, what are you doing? Pour it there! As she finishes pouring, Nai Nai hands her a bag of cooki

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Should I open these too?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (No. Just set those out. ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [No! You have to open everything! ] Billi tears open the plastic wrap on the cookies. Gu Gu h everyone bunches of flowers, and rips off some petals.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You have to rip the petals off too.] She demonstrates by aggressively tearing up the flowers.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Why do we have to rip the flowers? ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Because of the thieves! There are people who steal offerings off your grave and put it on their own family’s! This way, they won’t steal it!] Billi is perplexed by all this, but obeys nonetheless. Ha lights a cigarette and sets it upright on the grave.  64.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Hey, don’t give him cigarettes! He already quit!]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (teasing) [Ma, he never quit. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [He did! A few weeks before he passed, he quit. ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [He just told you he quit, but he never quit...]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (Ma... let the man smoke. He’s already dead, what else can happen? ] This makes Nai Nai laugh, and her laughter is contagious. Nai Nai takes a bite of banana, then feeds some to Billi. Jian eats an egg, Haiyan smokes a cigarette. It’s a feast

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke and ash rise from a blazing fire near the grave. Bi pokes at the fire with a stick, burning fake money, a pap iPhone. Nai Nai tosses a paper “coat” into the fire.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Burn the coat so Ye Ye can stay warm in the winter. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family is lined up in front of the grave. Ash settles gently on their hair and their clothes. Nai Nai leads them in paying their respects.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (to the grave) [Old timer, we all came to see you. Your grandson's getting married tomorrow. We came to get your blessing. ] The sun beats down. Heat rises from the cement. Billi squ through the lingering smoke.  65.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [We ask you to bless Hao Hao and his new bride. Bless them with happiness and bless their child with health and strength. One bow, two bows, three bows. ] As Nai Nai bows, the rest of the family follow.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Old timer, you left us too soon. Why did you have to leave so early? We hope you are at peace, wherever you are. We wish you well... One bow, two bows, three bows. ] They bow again. Hao Hao wipes away some tears.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Bless both our sons, Haiyan and Haibin with success in their businesses. One bow, two bows, three bows. ] More bows. Sweat pours down their faces, but Nai Nai is o getting started.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who else? Bless Billi, and her future. That all the elements of her life will come together soon. One bow, two bows, three bows. ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Still bowing! We’re all dizzy!]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (ignores her) And bless my sister. Bless her to...]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (interrupts, jokes) Bless me to win lots of money when I play Majong!] Nai Nai doesn’t crack a smile as she continues.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Bless your niece, YuPing and also Bao to do well on his exams. One bow, two bows, three bows. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the embers die down, a GRAVE CLEANER approaches to swe away the ashes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group meanders out of the cemetery, snaking through t sea of gravestones.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: When the time comes, let’s just send my ashes into the ocean. No one’s ever home anyway. ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? I’m here! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Still, let’s just send it in the ocean. That way no one has to travel back and forth all the time. ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: Send it into the ocean, what nonsense! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: You don’t agree? ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: I don’t agree! We’re Chinese... Humans need to return to the earth they came from! ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nai Nai lets out a dejected sigh as they continue their m back into life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive past a significant landmark.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Hey I remember that...

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [This is Nai Nai’s old neighborhood. ] Billi leans toward the window to see.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You remember that house? The one with the garden?  67.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Where? Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [We already passed it.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Can we go back? I want to see it!]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [There’s nothing to see. Our old neighborhood is long gone. Even I don’t recognize it anymore. ] Billi stares out the window, eyes longing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter through the hotel’s revolving door, one after another. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, BEDROOM - NIGHT Nai Nai soaks her feet in a bucket of hot water, as Mr. L attends to her.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LI
dialogues.text: [Is it hot enough?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It’s still a little cold.] Mr. Li carefully pours hot water from a kettle into the bucket.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (OK OK, that’s enough. ] Nai Nai watches as Mr. Li shuffles away holding the kettl

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Careful, don’t burn yourself. ] He doesn’t acknowledge her. Perhaps he didn’t even hear. Alone in her room, Nai Nai drops a certain performance of own. She is weary. She coughs. Perhaps she knows the trut Or perhaps, at 80, she just knows her time is limited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haiyan and Haibin smoke near an open window. They are engulfed by shadows, as if in hiding.  68.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [I think that’s something we’1l need to discuss with her. ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [What’s to discuss? Of course ma has to be buried beside ba. Her relationship with Mr. Li is just one of convenience! ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [But she’s still with him so I think it should be her decision. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Dad? Haiyan takes one last inhale before stamping out the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you smoking?

dialogues.speaker: HALYAN
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: You said you quit!

dialogues.speaker: HALYAN
dialogues.text: I did. A plume of smoke exits his nostrils.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I will. Uncle Haibin offers Haiyan another cigarette. Billi grabs box.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Stop giving him cigarettes! ]

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [Don’t control him! He’s your father, you shouldn’t control him.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Go to bed, Billi. Billi looks at the two men, sensing something’s up.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?  69.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Are you going to tell her?] Uncle Haibin examines Haiyan carefully. Haiyan doesn’t me his gaze. He sighs in a way that tells us he’s conflicted

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [I can’t, Billi. I won’t go against my family.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Dad...

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [You know Billi. You need to understand something. You guys moved to a Western country a long time ago, so you’re no longer connected to the Eastern way of looking at things. In America, you think one’s life belongs to oneself. But that’s the difference between the East and the West. In the East, your life is part of a whole. Family. Society. ] He lectures to her like she’s a child. Still, his words register.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You want to tell Nai Nai the truth because you feel too much responsibility carrying it. If you tell her, then you don’t have to feel guilty anymore. We’re not telling her because it is our responsibility to carry this emotional burden for her. ] INT. HOTEL BEST, HAO HAO AND AIKO’S ROOM - NIGHT Hao Hao, Auntie Ling and Jian crawl around the floor as B walks past the open door. She stops to watch them.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (Billi, don’t just stand there. Come help us find Aiko’s earring. ] Billi joins the others and gets on all fours.  70.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Where did you drop it?]

dialogues.speaker: HAO HAO
dialogues.text: [Somewhere close. ] Auntie Ling speaks to Aiko in Japanese. This is not subtitled.

dialogues.speaker: AUNTIE LING
dialogues.text: Be careful, don’t move! Maybe it’s caught on your clothes somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Mom. I want to stay. To help take care of Nai Nai. Jian looks at Billi like she’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: You stay? For what? You can’t cook, you can’t clean. You barely speak Chinese!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I'll figure it out. Jian realizes her daughter is being serious.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: So... you just stay and what... wait for her to die? What about the fellowship? You’re 30 years old and you just stop your life. Stay here. And every day she has to look at you... with that sad look on your face. That’s not nice for anyone, right?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: So what can I do? Tell me what I should do! Because she’s all that’s left. One of the few good memories I have of my childhood were those summers in Nai Nai’s house where they had that garden and Ye Ye and I used to catch dragonflies. We moved to the States and everything was different, everyone was gone and suddenly it was just the three of us. This finally gets to Jian and she softens.  71.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: I know it was hard. It was hard for us too...

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: But you chose to leave. You were adults and you understood why. I was just a kid. Nobody ever asked me what I wanted or how I felt. I just had to trust you and you told me it was a good thing to leave, but it didn’t feel like a good thing when you and Dad fought all the time because we didn’t have money and I was the weird Chinese girl in school who didn’t speak English and had no friends or anyone to talk to. I wanted to believe that it was a good thing, but all I saw was the fear in your eyes. I was confused and scared constantly because you guys never told me what was going on. Hao Hao, Aiko and Auntie Ling observe awkwardly as Billi finally lets it all go, tears streaming down her face. Hao Hao hands Billi a tissue.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And then Ye Ye died and you guys didn’t tell me he was sick so it felt like, he just vanished suddenly. And you didn’t even let me go to his funeral!

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: You were in school. We didn’t want you to miss school. We did what we thought was best for you.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: But I never saw him again! When I came back to China, he just wasn’t here anymore, and every time I come back, he’s just... gone. The house is gone, Adia’s gone, our Beijing home is gone, and soon she’1l be gone too. This is it. This is everything she’s been feeling. Billi out a deep sigh of relief from the catharsis.  72. INT. HOTEL BEST, BILLI’S BEDROOM - NIGHT YE YE (60) smokes a cigarette by the window. It’s the mid of the night and Billi opens her eyes, as if stirred by h presence. Her POV of the window: Ye Ye isn’t there, but his smoke lingers like a ghost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of identically-clad waiters shout a long-winded Chi welcome in unison, with wide smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lion dancer leads the bridal party in. Nai Nai is at th head of the family, greeting guests. Billi watches as Nai Nai works the room. Nai Nai gives Bi a stern glare to remind her of her duty. Putting on her b smile, Billi calls out to relatives with forced enthusias

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Hello uncle! Hello auntie! ] Nearby, Nai Nai catches up to Little Nai Nai.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Have you picked up the test results from the hospital? Weren't they supposed to be ready yesterday? ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Not yet, I’1l go tomorrow. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Tomorrow’s Saturday! Now we won’t be able to get it until Monday! ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [So I’1l get it Monday! Stop worrying! You're fine!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plates of CRABS exit the kitchen. Waiters set the crabs o tables. Kids run amuck as Nai Nai goes from table to tabl greeting guests. Hao Hao and Ami also greet guests. On stage, SUN AO (early 40’s) and his wife NICO give a to Both are tipsy and exuberant.  73.

dialogues.speaker: SUN AO
dialogues.text: [We are very happy to have you all back in Changchun! Doesn’t matter if you are in America or Japan or anywhere else... We are all one and the same! Citizens of the planet earth, of the Milky Way galaxy, of the universe! The only thing you should all know is that no matter how far you go, even if it’s to the moon! You will always have a home here in Changchun. We will always, always welcome you. ]

dialogues.speaker: NICO
dialogues.text: (Please, let’s all have a toast so you know when you come home to Changchun, you know that you’1ll always eat well, drink well and be merry! That way, you’1ll come back often! J As her family eats, Billi stares at the mountain of food front of her with no appetite. Mic feedback alerts the room that someone has taken the stage, though they’re reluctant to stop eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Haibin clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: [Keep eating, keep eating, I don't mean to interrupt your meal. As the eldest son, let me say a few words on behalf of myself and my brother. ] Their attention is dispersed as Uncle Haibin launches int his speech.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [It's been over 25 years since my brother and I have both been in China at the same time with our families. I'm very happy to welcome Aiko to our family. Perhaps next time, when we return again, we'll bring a new baby. ] Uncle Haibin’s voice drifts as he struggles to stay focus  74.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [My little brother and I haven't been around, and all these years, we've had to rely on all of you to take care of our ma. Chen Ping... you've been here all these years, by our mother’s side, treating her like your own. I’m very grateful to you. To all of you... I want to thank you, from the bottom of my heart. (long beat) But the person I want to thank the most...] His face quivers. Billi leans in, holding her breath. The entire room suddenly gets quiet. The awkward silence underscored by the sporadic SOUND OF CHAIRS AND UTENSILS.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [The person I want to thank the most... is... (his voice breaks) My mother. Forgive us for not being around, Ma. Everything I am, everything I've become... ] The dam ruptures with force. Tears stream down his face.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [-.. is because of my Ma!] Uncle Haibin's shoulders shake as he sobs uncontrollably stage. Uncle Haibin had warned her about this very thing, now he's the one falling apart. Billi watches in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Ma, you are the best mother in the entire world. (he bows) Thank you, Ma.] As he finishes, scattered applause fills the room. Billi turns to Nai Nai, who dabs the moisture from her ey with a handkerchief. It’s hard to tell what she’s thinkin Billi scans the rest of the room. HUNGRY GUESTS, includin Mr. Li and Bao, shove food into their mouths. She leans o to Haiyan.  75.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Does everyone know?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: I think most people don’t know. But I’m not sure. A giant shrimp suddenly appears in front of Billi’s face Nai Nai’s chopsticks.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Eat more, eat more! ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aiko wobbles slightly on stage as she delivers a toast. S speaks in JAPANESE, smiling broadly as Auntie Ling translates.

dialogues.speaker: AIKO
dialogues.text: I’m very happy to be here to celebrate with you all. Hao Hao is very nice, good man. I promise to always treat him well. And, we hope... maybe next time, we will bring back a baby. Hao Hao blushes. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unaffected LION DANCER smokes a cigarette. A BORED WAITER sits nearby on her iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nai Nai escorts Hao Hao and Aiko from table to table, toasting guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GENERAL ZHU, GENERAL FU and GENERAL MU sit around Nai Nai reminiscing about the good ol’ times. Haiyan and Uncle Ha are also at the table. Everyone chain smokes around her. As Billi approaches, Nai Nai motions to her.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [This is my granddaughter. ]

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MU
dialogues.text: [Oh she’s quite pretty!]  76.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL ZHU
dialogues.text: [Married yet?] Billi's smile tenses up as she stares at the shroud of sm around Nai Nai. Nai Nai herself seems unbothered.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (to Billi) [I used to work with these grandpas in the army. They’re all very important officials in the government now! ]

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL FU
dialogues.text: (laughing) [We're long retired now! ]

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL ZHU
dialogues.text: (to Nai Nai) [Hey Little Ting, I see you're limping. Is that still from the bullet you took in the war?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You still remember that?]

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL ZHU
dialogues.text: [How could I forget it? Tell you the truth, I had it all figured out. After the war, I was going to ask you to marry me. But then you got injured, and Little Wang carried you off and that was the end of that. Sly motherfucker. ] Nai Nai blushes and Billi clocks this.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL FU
dialogues.text: [That was a lifetime ago! Now, you're confessing your love?]

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL ZHU
dialogues.text: [Well if I don’t say anything now, I'll take it to my grave. Isn’t that right, Little Ting?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Little Ting? I’m old Ting now! ] General Mu turns to Billi.  77.

dialogues.speaker: GENERAL MU
dialogues.text: [It’s rare for you to come back, child. Take the opportunity to talk to your grandmother. ] Billi nods. Nai Nai gestures to the stage.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Go on. Go say a few words. ] Billi looks at Nai Nai, remembering her earlier words. Gracious. Generous in spirit. She takes a deep breath. INT. BANQUET HALL, STAGE —- CONTINUOUS Billi hesitantly makes her way up to the stage. She takes mic, but nobody's paying attention. She meets Nai Nai's encouraging gaze and starts.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Hello everyone. As you all know, I left China when I was very little.] She pauses, searching for words she hasn’t said in a long time, if ever.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [My Chinese isn't so good. I’m sorry...] A guest shouts “It’s great! Express yourself!” from off s followed by a few chuckles.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (OK... um... I almost didn’t come back this time. I uh...was very busy with my work. But I still came back. ] Billi looks at her parents, Uncle Haibin. All eyes are on her.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [In America, we don’t have many family. I miss all of you. I’m very happy to be here. I’m very happy to celebrate with you all.] She looks out at Nai Nai, beaming with pride.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [And I just hope... that you’re happy too. ]  78. Scattered applause as Billi leaves the stage. Thank god that’s over. But then she remembers something and quickly runs back up -—

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Oh, and uh...] (yells offstage to Haiyan) Dad, how do you say congratulations?

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: Gong xi!

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Gong xi Hao Hao and Aiko! The room bursts into applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi and Dad sing a karaoke duet of the Fugee’s version "Killing Me Softly”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON STAGE. Aiko and Hao Hao sing a Japanese karaoke song. They're both incredibly off key. MAIN TABLE. Jian and Little Nai Nai watch the awkward performance in silence. Jian senses the weight of Little Nai’s grief amidst all this celebration.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (Auntie, you've spent so long taking care of your sister. You also have to take care of yourself and consider what’s next for you.]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (nods ) [You don't need to worry about me. I'm very rational about all this. After she’s gone, I can go be with my husband in ShenZhen. All these years, working out there alone has been hard for him too, but he’s almost retired. And then he and I will be able to take ourselves on a world tour! ] Jian’s not fooled by her feigned cheerfulness, but plays along.  79.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [You can come visit us in America...] Little Nai Nai’s performative smile grows wider.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: (Definitely! I've always wanted to see your house! ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [We'll take you around the country. Wherever you want to go.] Little Nai Nai nods a little too eagerly.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I can even go visit Haibin and his family in Japan. See, I've thought things through very clearly. You don't have to worry about me.] As Little Nai Nai turns back around to face away from Jia her smile drops. The effort of these performative emotion takes its toll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MOTHER DAUGHTER DUO does a choreographed K-pop dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family flaps their arms like birds. This is a drinking game. Joyful and exhilarating, the game allows t all to forget for the time being. Hao Hao keeps messing up the game so he drinks. He drinks and drinks and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON STAGE. A YOUNG CHINESE WOMAN sings a melancholic Itali opera. In the middle of the room, Hao Hao bawls uncontrollably. Seeing this, Gu Gu runs up to him. A few TEEN GIRLS also huddle around him. Gu Gu locks eyes with Billi and waves frantically. Billi rushes over, searching the room for Nai Nai. Nai Nai is distracted by a conversation with Mrs. Gao.  80.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: (What’s wrong Hao Hao? Why are you sad? ]

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [He’s fine. It’s OK.] Gu Gu’s eyes well with tears.

dialogues.speaker: TEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: [Why are you crying Hao Hao? Don’t cry...] As she says this, Teen Girl #2 begins to cry. This gets T Girl #1 crying too. It’s contagious - the louder one girl cries, the louder the other girl cries. Gu Gu dries her tears, annoyed by the hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: GU GU
dialogues.text: [Why are YOU crying? ]

dialogues.speaker: TEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: [I don’t know...]

dialogues.speaker: TEEN GIRL
dialogues.text: [I don’t know either! ] INT. BANQUET HALL, BACK AREA — DAY Billi tries to console Hao Hao. They can’t communicate, b it’s a tender moment. INT. BANQUET HALL, PORTRAIT BACKDROP —- DAY Nai Nai is surrounded by the entire family, posed for a portrait. Uncle Haibin sets up the camera on a tripod. Nai Nai notices Hao Hao’s face - it’s red and puffy from crying.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [What's the matter Hao Hao? Did you drink too much? ] Tears leak down Hao Hao’s face.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [You can’t take a wedding photo with the groom crying. What are you crying about?]  81.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [He’s fine. He’s just happy. Those are tears of joy! Isn't that right, Hao Hao?] Hao Hao nods weakly.

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: [OK, everybody look at the camera! ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Will you take one with my camera too? Sis, where is it?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I gave it to Mrs. Gao. It’s in her purse. ]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Where is she?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I sent her to the hospital to pick up my test results. ] Little Nai Nai’s face drops and Billi clocks this. Uncle into the photo -

dialogues.speaker: UNCLE HAIBIN
dialogues.text: (On the count of three, everybody say ‘eggplant!’] Everyone says ‘eggplant’ with a forced smile. The camera off with a flash. Billi and Little Nai Nai’s faces are frozen in a look of shock. As the rest of the family stays frozen in a smile, Billi awkwardly excuses herself from the group photo. She begin run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi sprints through the city with all her might. She st momentarily to catch her breath and her thoughts catch up her actions. There’s no time to think. She takes off running again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi runs inside, asks someone for directions.  82. INT. THE PEOPLE’S HOSPITAL, SECOND FLOOR - DAY Billi bolts up the stairs and frantically searches for Mr Gao. She spots her and runs up to her.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GAO
dialogues.text: Oh, what are you doing here?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (out of breath) Did you get it?]

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GAO
dialogues.text: The test results? Yea.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Where? ] Mrs. Gao digs into her purse and pulls out a document. Sh hands it to Billi, scanning the panic on her face.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GAO
dialogues.text: What’s the matter? What’s it say?] Billi looks up at Mrs. Gao, confused.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I can’t read Chinese. Didn’t you read it?]

dialogues.speaker: MRS. GAO
dialogues.text: (blushes ) I... I can’t read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) I never went to school. ] Despite her relief, Billi softens with sympathy.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Come on, let’s go.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The test result document is scanned into a computer. Billi, Little Nai Nai and Mrs. Gao huddle over the COPY CENTER OWNER as he tries to doctor the results in his computer.

dialogues.speaker: COPY CENTER OWNER
dialogues.text: [What should I write?]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Just write benign shadows. ]  83.

dialogues.speaker: COPY CENTER OWNER
dialogues.text: [Benign shadows? What’s that?]

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [It means... it’s not fatal.] INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT —- NIGHT The entire family gathers around Nai Nai as she examines document. Time slows. Nai Nai nods, as if she knew all al

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [See. I told you I was fine! ] EXT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT - DUSK The family walks in epic slow-motion as a single unit. Little Nai Nai, Aiko and Hao Hao. Uncle and Auntie. Haiya and Jian. Billi is framed in the center. They're all in this together. There’s no turning back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s dark and the city is still asleep. A light comes on one window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nai Nai opens the closet door and grabs a RED ENVELOPE. S hands it to Billi.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Don’t give me money, Nai Nai...]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Take it, child! Take it! I gave one to Hao Hao so I want to give you one too. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: (But... I didn’t get married. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Even more reason! You’re all on your own, with no one to support you. And I can’t be of much help to you. I’m sorry. I wish there was more I could do to help you.] Nai Nai’s eyes well with tears as she grapples with her helplessness. She pushes the envelope into Billi’s hand.  84.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [Take it, my child.] Billi nods, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [And don’t spend it on anything practical like rent! Buy yourself something nice...] Billi smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I don’t want to leave, Nai Nai.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You'll be back.] Billi fights back tears.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: [I know you’re always thinking of me. But you don’t need to worry. I'm fine. I’ve been taking the new medicine and I feel much better. ]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Really?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [You have work to do. You have so much ahead of you. I’m proud of you. ] Billi diverts her eyes, something clearly on her mind. Af a beat, she decides to be honest.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [I didn’t get the grant. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Really? You just heard?]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Last week. I didn’t tell you because... (beat) I didn’t want you to worry. ] Nai Nai considers this and nods.  85.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’m not worried. You’1l be fine. Child, I’ve walked the path of life and I have a piece of advice for you. Whatever you encounter in life, you must fight to stay positive. Your journey ahead is still long and you will have difficulties, but when you encounter something catastrophic, you have to think it through with an open mind and find the light. Don’t be a bull ramming its horns into the dark corner of a room. You'll get stuck. Your mind is incredibly powerful. Where your thoughts go, your body follows. You must keep your perspective... and keep going forward. ] Billi nods as she absorbs Nai Nai’s advice.

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (beat) [You've always been fearless. So I know you’re gonna be fine. ] Billi puts her head on Nai Nai’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: [Are you really OK, Nai Nai?]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Yes! Why would I lie to you?] There’s a knock on the door as Little Nai Nai opens the d

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Taxi’s here. Come on.] Billi and Nai Nai savor this moment, side by side. Mrs. G passes them in the doorway, sweeping. INT. NAI NAI’S APARTMENT, STAIRWELL - MORNING Chaos and commotion as Billi, Jian and Haiyan attempt to goodbye. It’s impossible, so instead of goodbye, they sho at each other, everyone overlapping.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: (Ma, don’t come down! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I‘11 come down with you, come on.]  86.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [Sis, you don’t need to go! It’s cold outside! ]

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: (Ma, don’t catch a cold!]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I’m coming, I’m coming! Hurry up let’s go!] Nai Nai struggles down the dingy stairwell despite everyo urging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi and Nai Nai hug goodbye. Both struggle to maintain composure.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Don't cry, Nai Nai.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: I'm not crying. You don't cry.]

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: I'm not crying. ] Billi smiles as convincingly as possible.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be back to see you.]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Yes, I know. You'll be back. I’11 see you very soon. Go on, let's not drag this out anymore. It hurts my heart. ]

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Ma, take care of yourself. ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: Stop it. Don't make a scene. Just go. Hurry up or you'll miss your flight!]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all back to shouting.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: [Go upstairs, Ma! It's chilly! Hurry and go!]  87.

dialogues.speaker: HAIYAN
dialogues.text: [Ma, go upstairs! ]

dialogues.speaker: NAI NAI
dialogues.text: [I will after you get in the car. Go on or you’1ll miss your flight! ] They get in the car, but Nai Nai doesn’t leave. She limps after the car as it pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POV from the back windshield. Nai Nai stands at the end o the alley, watching as the car drives away. She waves as squat figure gets smaller. Little Nai Nai tries to get her sister to leave, but she doesn’t budge. She remains in the same spot - watching, waving, her heart in her throat. The car turns the corner just like that, Nai Nai’s gone. Billi turns around, numb with grief. To her surprise, she sees Jian weeping silently. There are no words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haiyan is asleep in the front seat. After what seems like endless silence, Billi finally turns to her mother.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Mom... if one of you guys got sick... in America... what should I do? Would you want me to lie to you?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: Definitely not! Are you crazy? Billi and Mom both chuckle through their tears. At least they’re on the same page about something.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you regret that we brought you to America?

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Of course not. Another long pause as Billi considers Mom’s question.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you? Leaving I mean.  88.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: I don’t regret, but... it’s complicated. Outside the car, the sun is rising and the city begins to wake.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know... when I was still living in China, when you were very young, I visited a blind psychic. He told me I’d have three children. He said there’s a lot of water in my life. Water means talent, so a lot of talent. But my water is long and flowing - a river, so I cannot keep any of it. POV of long empty highways to the airport.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But my daughter, he said. She is also water but she is big ocean water. So my river will flow into her.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: What if I can’t be your ocean?

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: It’s not whether or not you can be. The psychic said you already are. If you believe it, then it’s true.

dialogues.speaker: BILLI
dialogues.text: Well he was wrong. You didn't have three children.

dialogues.speaker: JIAN
dialogues.text: No, he was right. I was meant to have three. But it was China. We couldn't. You were first. So you were it. Billi’s heart swells with compassion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom and Dad are fast asleep. They’re weary and vulnerable They’re human.  89. INT. BILLI’S APARTMENT - NIGHT Billi walks into the dark apartment with her suitcase. Despite being a small studio apartment, her place now fee enormous. Empty. Silent. Nothing but her own shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billi strolls down the sidewalk, the weight of the world her shoulders. Overwhelmed by emotion, she appears to be the verge of breaking down. She stops in the middle of the street. Strangers walk aro her, absorbed in their own lives. As Billi stands there amidst the chaos of the city, a different energy suddenly overtakes her. Instead of crumbling, she lifts her chin and inhales deeply. Then, with all the life force in her, with the spirit of Nai, she shouts -—

dialogues.speaker: HA
dialogues.text: EXT. NAI NAI’S NEIGHBORHOOD, CHANGCHUN CHINA - DAY Our familiar peach-colored buildings surround a LARGE TRE Billi’s voice echoes loudly into this shot - echoing acro the globe. BIRDS scatter from the tree, flying off into the distance a unit, the pattern of their formation silhouetted agains the sky.
